title: Drawing, Design for a Five-Legged Dark Oak Dining Table, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for a Five-Legged Dark Oak Dining Table
medium: Graphite and red and yellow colored pencil on thin, cream paper
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: In graphite, in lower right quarter of sheet: "Dark Oak-Dining Table $ 120.00"; in graphite, at upper left of design: "[illegible] Top Surface to/avoid marring from/hot dishes"; in graphite; at upper right of design: "5'.0" Diameter"; in graphite, at center right of sheet: "to extend to 12'.0""; in graphite, at lower right with an arrow pointing to the right leg: "Brass boots"; in graphite, at lower center of design, with an arrow pointing to the base: "central leg-"
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Round and molded table top with a dividing stretcher running across the center; is raised on a plain column-like support sitting atop a molded base on splayed legs with brass sabots on casters indicated by yellow color pencil.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for a Five-Legged Dark Oak Dining Table, 1900–05. Graphite and red and yellow colored pencil on thin, cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-123.
